before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"96ijl","text":"Thoroughly rinse and autoclave oyster shells (can be re-used indefinitely by soaking in 10% bleach overnight, rinsing thoroughly, and autoclaving)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cited_protocols.title: Snail husbandry for maintaining the Schistosoma mansoni life cycle

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4pfd5","text":"Maintenance and general husbandry of schistosome-susceptible snails, including but not limited to Biomphalaria glabrata fresh water snails. The purpose of this SOP is to outline the weekly protocols required for general husbandry of a Schistosoma mansoni life cycle through the use of Biomphalaria glabrata snails.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":98,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":235,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":285,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0l3c","text":"Coarse grit poultry oyster shells ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jip6","text":"Aquariums (maximum density of snails is ~1 adult snail per 1L water volume)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38nu5","text":"Air compressor or air source","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g2m8","text":"Marina blue airline tubing (pet store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4qc4","text":"25mm air stone cylinders (pet store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8nk1","text":"Artificial lotus leaves (pet store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a4hb","text":"Temperature-regulated room, aquarium heaters, or incubators to house snail tanks (temperature at 25°C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jpl6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70kvr","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3vnm2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"darn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"725io","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ncju","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9p58v","text":"Snail gel food (see recipes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5338h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35pjv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsggf","text":"10X AQUARIUM WATER","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"384es","text":"5.56g CaCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6o8u","text":"12.28g MgSO4-7H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":11,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c7sg","text":"0.43g K2SO4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":7,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crum9","text":"4.2g NaHCO3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj71","text":"480µl FeCl3-6H2O (0.5g/100ml water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":14,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crani","text":"Fill to 10L and store in 1L bottles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62gqv","text":"Dilute to 1x: 9L MQ water + 1L 10x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vo6b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gucd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lhru","text":"SNAIL GEL FOOD https://www.afbr-bri.org/schistosomiasis/standard-operating-procedures/gel-snail-food-preparation/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":15,"length":98}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmvfo","text":"1L diH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":6,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gfpv","text":"4g sodium alginate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ut6c","text":"16g barley grass powder (health food store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vvnj","text":"4g wheat germ (health food store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn9ot","text":"4g fish flakes/pellet pre-ground mix (pet store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49lfb","text":"2g powdered milk (health food store or Amazon)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7au6","text":"2 liter 2% CaCl2 solution (40g CaCl2 + 2 liter H2O)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":48,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9epo4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da3db","text":"Add sodium alginate to 1L diH2O and heat on magnetic stirrer with large stir bar, stirring rapidly (temp should be ~ 80°C)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":29,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44u4q","text":"Add barley grass powder and stir until homogeneous","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s7uk","text":"Add the pulverized wheat germ/fish flakes/powdered milk mixture","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es2b0","text":"Stir for several minutes until thoroughly mixed","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91fgv","text":"Divide mixture between 2 trays so that it is about 15mm deep and cool at 4°C 3-4hrs until gel is set","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qed6","text":"Gently flood with 2% CaCl2","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":25,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41pgb","text":"Place at 4°C overnight (can combine multiple slabs of gel into one tank to save space)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as8cn","text":"Pour off CaCl2 and rinse 2x with diH2O","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":13,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":36,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43d7o","text":"Slice into cubes of approximately 15mm x 15mm and store in re-sealable bag at 4°C. Use within 1 week and do not overfeed.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s5l0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0a1h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":2715,"mol_weight":0,"name":"MilliQ Schistosomiasis.

references.title: The effect of seasonal temperature and experimental illumination on reproductive rate in the snail Biomphalaria glabrata
references.authors: Barbosa ND, Pimentel-Souza F, Sampaio IB

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Preparing a new aquarium tank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2fn6g","text":"Label clean aquarium with appropriate information in permanent marker (i.e. date, owner, age, numbers of individuals, exposure date, expected patent date, experiment number, etc). Example labels are attached    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":207,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":209,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"212589F0CFB211ED93ACE33E29856512","id":358791,"original_name":"infected_new tanks.avery","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k8nhbdu5f.avery"}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"2F55E4C0CFB211ED93ACE33E29856512","id":358792,"original_name":"uninfected_new tanks.avery","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k8nibdu5f.avery"}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a new aquarium tank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8pg4s","text":"Rinse a generous handful of autoclaved oyster shells with water until it runs clear and add to the base of the tank","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a new aquarium tank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"26ga6","text":"Fill aquarium 1/2-3/4 full with 1x Aquarium Water (see recipe in \"MATERIALS\" section)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a new aquarium tank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8b7g5","text":"Place a clean airline and air stone in aquarium and put in appropriate heated incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a new aquarium tank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1okvr","text":"Connect airline and assure that the appropriate amount of air is going to the tank and all other tanks connected to the same airline. Note that changing the number of tanks in a connected airline results in decreased or increased air pressure to other tanks so adjusted accordingly","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":134,"length":147}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a new aquarium tank
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bbmdm","text":"For infected snails, keep water level at or just below 1/2 full to reduce chance of splashing when handling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rsna","text":"Add snails to the tank (\u003c100 baby snails/10L water; \u003c10 adult breeder snails/10L; \u003c30 juvenile parasite-exposed snails/10L)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cv6v4","text":"Add one 15ml falcon tube styrofoam rack to breeder tanks (snails also love to lay eggs on artificial lotus leaves)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail feeding (2x/week)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6k8e","text":"Place one cube (15mm x 15mm) of snail gel per 6-8 adult snails or two per 100 baby snails (use size and number of snails to estimate amount of snail gel to give to each tank)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail feeding (2x/week)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8pkjf","text":"To prevent overgrowth of bacteria, do not overfeed snails. If any snail gel is leftover \u003e1 day after a feeding, then the snails are being overfed and reduce as necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail tank housekeeping
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e4h02","text":"Visually inspect the snail tanks during feedings for heavy bacterial and/or waste contamination (turbid and/or smelly water, large amount of debris collected in oyster shells) and/or heavy rotifer infestations. If any of these is detected, rinse the snails thoroughly with fresh 1x Aquarium Water and prepare a new tank, airline, and bubbler for the snails","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail tank housekeeping
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9eh9e","text":"Once a week top up water on tanks to their appropriate levels using MilliQ H2O. To top up the water use the hose connected to the MilliQ water source","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":76,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail tank housekeeping
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6s6b3","text":"Replace 10% of the dirtiest tanks each week","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail egg collection and baby snail maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"crglb","text":"Fill a 100ml beaker or small dish with 1x Aquarium Water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail egg collection and baby snail maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c3vo","text":"Working with one styrofoam rack at a time, use featherweight forceps to gently remove the egg masses from the rack and place in the beaker (slide forceps under egg mass and lift away gently)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail egg collection and baby snail maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"95add","text":"Repeat for all styrofoam racks from breeder tanks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail egg collection and baby snail maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fts4j","text":"Check the egg masses under the microscope for rotifer infestation. Discard individual egg masses with heavy rotifer infestations. Rinse egg masses if rotifers are present in the water until none are seen under microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail egg collection and baby snail maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7j5uo","text":"When finished collecting, empty the beaker into a prepared nursery/baby tank for that particular week (1 new nursery/baby tank per week) rinse container well with 1x Aquarium Water to remove stuck baby snails/egg masses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Snail egg collection and baby snail maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"748sf","text":"Split any tanks that have \u003e100 baby snails to promote growth","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Decontaminating infected and uninfected snail tank and tank water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8b30t","text":"Remove airline with air stone and place in tank. If applicable, keep styrofoam rack in tank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Decontaminating infected and uninfected snail tank and tank water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d08dd","text":"Remove any snails that might be kept – leave dead shells. Add 20ml of 5000ppm Klorsept and leave overnight (minimum 6 hours)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Decontaminating infected and uninfected snail tank and tank water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b7b42","text":"After this period, dispose of the decontaminated water using the sieve or colander to collect oyster shells and dead snails","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Decontaminating infected and uninfected snail tank and tank water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ufag","text":"Rinse tank with diH2O and then spray tank with 70% EtOH. Scrub tank with green scouring pad, rinse  thoroughly with diH2O and allow to air dry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":19,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":119,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Decontaminating infected and uninfected snail tank and tank water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5e9vo","text":"Styrofoam racks, air stones, and airline should be sprayed with 70% EtOH, rinsed liberally with diH2O, and air dried","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":99,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Decontaminating infected and uninfected snail tank and tank water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"atnvk","text":"Put decontaminated and rinsed oyster shells and dead snails in an autoclave tray and autoclave when full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Snail husbandry for maintaining the Schistosoma mansoni life cycle

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"aah6l","text":"For all procedures described, wear appropriate PPE: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m8fr","text":"Lab coat ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eeca","text":"Long-cuff gloves","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arbb1","text":"Waterproof vinyl apron (when working with pre-patent and patent snails)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f6av","text":"Face shield (when working with pre-patent and patent snails)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38cfl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rucv","text":"IMPORTANT. ALL pre-patent and patent snails must be treated as if they are infectious (i.e. wear face shield and waterproof vinyl apron). Infected snails will release small amounts of cercariae all the time, even if kept in the dark. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
